AdaGrad¶

class optimizers.AdaGrad.AdaGrad(learning_rate=0.01, epsilon=1e-07)[source]¶

Implements the Adaptive Gradient (AdaGrad) optimizer.

AdaGrad adapts the learning rate for each parameter individually, performing larger updates for infrequent and smaller updates for frequent parameters. It is particularly well-suited for sparse data. Its main weakness is that the learning rate aggressively decays and may stop learning too early.

The update formulas are: 1. n_t = n_{t-1} + g_t^2 2. θ_t = θ_{t-1} - η * g_t / sqrt(n_t + ε)

lr¶

The learning rate (η).

Type:

float

epsilon¶

A small constant for numerical stability (ε).

Type:

float

accumulator¶

The ‘memory’ that stores the sum of squared gradients.

Type:

list

step(params, grads)[source]¶

Performs a single optimization step for all parameters.

Parameters:

  • params (list) – A list of lists containing the model’s parameters. Expected structure: [[weights1, biases1], [weights2, biases2], …]

  • grads (list) – A list of lists containing the gradients for each parameter, with the same structure as params.
